Title.evidence: Title: A Randomised Controlled Trial on Post-Operative Cognitive Dysfunction

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included English-language quantitative studies on human subjects using standard cognitive assessments.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to critically appraise and define POCD, synthesizing its attributes, risk factors, and consequences.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the definition and characterization of POCD, measured over several weeks to years.

Result_Outcome.evidence: POCD was defined as subtle-to-extensive cognitive changes affecting single or multiple domains post-surgery, transient and reversible, lasting weeks to years.
